intro: Lotononis pallens, commonly known as the white lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, often arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are alternate, narrow, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Lotononis pallens is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
